content.json:
# Performance Operations Dashboard

Consolidated workbook for Gremlin operation performance monitoring: RU consumption, latency percentiles, partition pressure trends, and operation success/failure rates.

**Telemetry Events:** `Graph.Query.Executed`, `Graph.Query.Failed`

**Objective:** Provide comprehensive visibility into Cosmos DB Gremlin operations to detect partition pressure, cost anomalies, and performance degradation before they impact gameplay.

**Related Issues:** #289 (RU & Latency Overview), #290 (RU vs Latency Correlation), #291 (Partition Pressure Trend), #296 (Success/Failure Rate & RU Cost)

**References:** ADR-002 (partition pressure thresholds), docs/observability.md

## Gremlin Operation RU & Latency Overview

**Purpose:** Summarize RU charge and latency percentiles per critical Gremlin operation to spot emerging hot operations.

**Thresholds:**
- üü° P95 latency >500ms (amber)
- üî¥ P95 latency >600ms (red)
- üü° AvgRU >15 (amber - placeholder)
- üî¥ AvgRU >20 (red - placeholder)

**Note:** RU thresholds are placeholders; tune via issue #297 after baseline data collection.

content.title: Top Operations by Call Volume (Last 24h, fallback to 6h)

content.json:
## RU vs Latency Correlation

**Purpose:** Detect pressure-induced slowdowns by correlating RU charge to latency.

**Interpretation:**
- Pearson correlation >0.6: Strong positive correlation (rising RU ‚Üí rising latency)
- Correlation displayed only when sample size ‚â•30
- Scatter plot helps identify outliers and operational clusters

content.query:
// RU vs Latency Correlation - Scatter Plot (Issue #290)
let timeRange = 2h;
customEvents
| where timestamp > ago(timeRange)
| where name == 'Graph.Query.Executed'
| extend operationName = tostring(customDimensions.operationName),
         latencyMs = todouble(customDimensions.latencyMs),
         ruCharge = todouble(customDimensions.ruCharge)
| where isnotempty(operationName) and isnotnull(ruCharge) and isnotnull(latencyMs) and latencyMs > 0
| project timestamp, operationName, ruCharge, latencyMs
| order by timestamp desc
| take 1000
content.title: RU vs Latency Scatter (Last 2h, max 1000 points)
Pearson Correlation: RU vs Latency (sample ‚â•30)

content.query:
// RU vs Latency Trend (dual axis) - 5-min buckets (Issue #290)
let timeRange = 2h;
let bucketSize = 5m;
customEvents
| where timestamp > ago(timeRange)
| where name == 'Graph.Query.Executed'
| extend operationName = tostring(customDimensions.operationName),
         latencyMs = todouble(customDimensions.latencyMs),
         ruCharge = todouble(customDimensions.ruCharge)
| where isnotempty(operationName) and isnotnull(ruCharge) and isnotnull(latencyMs)
| summarize 
    AvgRU = avg(ruCharge),
    P95Latency = percentile(latencyMs, 95)
  by bucket = bin(timestamp, bucketSize)
| order by bucket asc
content.title: Average RU vs P95 Latency Trend (5-min buckets, 2h)

content.json:
## Partition Pressure Trend (RU% + 429 Overlay)

**Purpose:** Detect sustained high RU utilization and throttling signals before migration actions are needed.

**Thresholds (ADR-002):**
- üü° RU% >70% (amber)
- üî¥ RU% >80% (red)
- üö® RU% >70% for ‚â•3 consecutive intervals ‚Üí requires investigation

**Configuration:** Set `MAX_RU_PER_INTERVAL` parameter above (e.g., 1000 RU/s √ó 300s = 300000). If not configured, panel displays "Baseline throughput not configured" and suppresses % calculation.

**Edge Cases Handled:**
- Zero RU intervals ‚Üí displays 0%
- Sparse 429 occurrences ‚Üí renders with appropriate scaling
- Missing baseline ‚Üí informational state (not error)

‚ö†Ô∏è **Baseline throughput not configured** - Set the `MAX_RU_PER_INTERVAL` parameter above to enable RU% calculation. Example: For 1000 RU/s provisioned throughput with 5-minute buckets, use 1000 √ó 300 = 300000.

content.title: RU% and 429 Count (5-min buckets, 24h) {MaxRuPerInterval:label}
Sustained Pressure Alerts (RU >70% for ‚â•3 intervals)

content.json:
## Operation Success/Failure Rate & RU Cost

**Purpose:** Provide visibility into reliability and cost efficiency to prioritize high-cost or failure-prone operations.

**Thresholds:**
- üü° Failure Rate >2% (amber)
- üî¥ Failure Rate >5% (red)

**Note:** Operations with <10 total calls are listed separately as low-volume.

content.query:
// Operation Success/Failure Rate & RU Cost Table (Issue #296)
let timeRange = 24h;
let minCalls = 10;
let successEvents = customEvents
| where timestamp > ago(timeRange)
| where name == 'Graph.Query.Executed'
| extend operationName = tostring(customDimensions.operationName),
         ruCharge = todouble(customDimensions.ruCharge),
         latencyMs = todouble(customDimensions.latencyMs)
| where isnotempty(operationName);
let failureEvents = customEvents
| where timestamp > ago(timeRange)
| where name == 'Graph.Query.Failed'
| extend operationName = tostring(customDimensions.operationName)
| where isnotempty(operationName);
// Aggregate success
let successAgg = successEvents
| summarize 
    SuccessCalls = count(),
    TotalRU = sum(ruCharge),
    MissingRU = countif(isnull(ruCharge)),
    P95Latency = percentile(latencyMs, 95)
  by operationName;
// Aggregate failures
let failureAgg = failureEvents
| summarize FailedCalls = count() by operationName;
// Join and compute metrics
successAgg
| join kind=leftouter failureAgg on operationName
| extend FailedCalls = coalesce(FailedCalls, 0)
| extend TotalCalls = SuccessCalls + FailedCalls
| extend FailureRate = round(100.0 * FailedCalls / TotalCalls, 2)
| extend AvgRUSuccess = iff(MissingRU > 0.3 * SuccessCalls, 0.0, TotalRU / SuccessCalls)
| extend AvgRUDisplay = iff(MissingRU > 0.3 * SuccessCalls, "n/a", tostring(round(AvgRUSuccess, 2)))
| extend RUPerCall = iff(AvgRUSuccess > 0, round(AvgRUSuccess, 2), 0.0)
| extend RUPerCallDisplay = iff(MissingRU > 0.3 * SuccessCalls, "n/a", tostring(RUPerCall))
| extend Category = iff(TotalCalls < minCalls, "Low Volume", "Normal")
| project operationName, SuccessCalls, FailedCalls, FailureRate, AvgRUDisplay, RUPerCallDisplay, P95Latency = round(P95Latency, 0), Category
| order by TotalCalls = SuccessCalls + FailedCalls desc
content.title: Operation Reliability & RU Cost (Last 24h)
RU Data Quality Check
Optimization Priority Assessment

content.json:
### Interpretation Guide

**RU & Latency Overview:**
- High P95/P99 latency (>500ms): Operation may be bottlenecked or experiencing pressure
- High AvgRU operations: Review query efficiency and consider optimization
- "n/a" RU values: >30% events missing RU data; telemetry incomplete

**Correlation Analysis:**
- Strong correlation (>0.6): Rising RU directly impacts latency ‚Üí potential partition pressure
- Weak/negative correlation: Latency driven by factors other than RU (network, complexity)
- Sample size warning: Correlations require ‚â•30 events per operation for statistical reliability

**Edge Cases:**
- **Missing ruCharge**: Events without RU data are omitted from scatter plot and correlation calculation. Check "Missing RU count" in warning messages.
- **LatencyMs=0**: These rare events are filtered out to avoid skewing correlation calculations.
- **High RU with low latency**: Legitimate pattern showing efficient high-throughput operations; correlation will be weak or negative (expected).
- **Very high RU outliers**: Scatter plot may show extreme RU values. Future enhancement: outlier removal toggle (RU > median √ó configurable factor).

**Partition Pressure:**
- Sustained RU% >70%: Monitor closely; prepare migration plan
- 429 spikes: Immediate throttling; review hot operations
- Configure MAX_RU_PER_INTERVAL for accurate % calculation

**Reliability & Cost:**
- High failure rate (>5%): Investigate error patterns
- High RU/Call with low success rate: Expensive failing operations
- Low volume operations: Not enough data for reliable metrics
- AvgRU(Success): Average RU per successful call (excludes failures)
- RU/Call Ratio: Same as AvgRU for cost-per-operation analysis

**Export & Query Documentation:**
- Full export instructions (CSV, JSON, Azure CLI): See `docs/observability.md` ¬ß Performance Operations Dashboard
- Kusto query examples for external analysis tools (R, Python, Excel)
- Workbook JSON configuration export via Azure Portal Advanced Editor

parameters.name: MaxRuPerInterval
parameters.description: Maximum RU capacity per 5-minute interval (e.g., 1000 RU/s * 300s = 300000). Leave empty to see configuration banner.
parameters.label: MAX_RU_PER_INTERVAL
